record.dc:title: 342HA1 Dallas Site 8HA1, Hamilton Co., TN. Mound. Feature 22, Details of construction of clay bench. Small stakes were set at close intervals at a vertical position and horizontally placed cane was fastened to the front side of these stakes. Sq. 13R4. Direction northeast.
record.wpa:narrative: Face of ledge was covered with puddled clay mixed with grass and burned to a brick red. This burning carbonized the cane and some of the stakes. Post molds at left border of the entrance-way on the south side of the structure. Is an integral part of Feature 14. Deep fire basin modelled rim, 0.6' wide and 0.3' high, with puddled clay lining over entire bottom. Contained some ash and roof material when found.
